text:
I would email bdp/Neil as he might be able to share more details and yes things are a bit hacky when it comes to requesting both as bflw will serialise based on the priority Lee has shared, this was meant to be temporary but I am not sure how best to output to the user whilst matching a conventional marketBook request. However the data for both is in the cache if you want to pull it out.

Have you tried testing yourself with a quiet market? Set debug to true on the logs and see the updates coming in

text: both, for live you will have a single `Market` object with two different MarketBooks being sent through it (same marketId but different data because of the data filter) something to be aware of that might not impacting anything and tbh its on my list to isolate and fix the potential issue

text:
Can any action be taken of orders of status: VIOLATION ? Can funds be tied up or be unable to be cancelled as the result of an order having this status? 

I'm working on fixing the issues that cause this order status occurring but when they do it seems they cannot be cancelled through market.cancel_order(order, force=True)

elements.text:
Can any action be taken of orders of status: VIOLATION ? Can funds be tied up or be unable to be cancelled as the result of an order having this status? 

I'm working on fixing the issues that cause this order status occurring but when they do it seems they cannot be cancelled through market.cancel_order(order, force=True)

text: What's the reason for the original VIOLATION?

elements.text: What's the reason for the original VIOLATION?

text: did you check if the order has any size_matched? I cant recall ever having the VIOLATION order_status, but i would ve assumed in those cases nothing would be matched so there would be no reason to cancel

elements.text: did you check if the order has any size_matched? I cant recall ever having the VIOLATION order_status, but i would ve assumed in those cases nothing would be matched so there would be no reason to cancel

text: OrderStatus.VIOLATION would return order.complete == True, so there shouldnt be anything left to do with that order

elements.text: OrderStatus.VIOLATION would return order.complete == True, so there shouldnt be anything left to do with that order

text: So the most recent time was due to market suspension so nothing suspicious there but there was an occasion where it looked as if there was a small amount ~70p tied up in a partially cancelled bet of status VIOLATION, partially matched £24.30. This then filled the maxlivetradecount=1 limit and I could not move on as I was unable to cancel the remaining amount. I was wondering if this was something expected to be encountered or if it is more likely a one off fuck up my side (misinterpreting my logs). I've made changes over the past week and haven't witnessed this problem since but am curious if i should have violation checks in place for bets that cannot be altered but have small remaining amounts

elements.text: So the most recent time was due to market suspension so nothing suspicious there but there was an occasion where it looked as if there was a small amount ~70p tied up in a partially cancelled bet of status VIOLATION, partially matched £24.30. This then filled the maxlivetradecount=1 limit and I could not move on as I was unable to cancel the remaining amount. I was wondering if this was something expected to be encountered or if it is more likely a one off fuck up my side (misinterpreting my logs). I've made changes over the past week and haven't witnessed this problem since but am curious if i should have violation checks in place for bets that cannot be altered but have small remaining amounts

text: The Docs suggest that orders with this status should never have been placed so I believe I am just mistaken and funds cannot be tied up in VIOLATION orders but wanted to clarify as testing is ramping up

elements.text: The Docs suggest that orders with this status should never have been placed so I believe I am just mistaken and funds cannot be tied up in VIOLATION orders but wanted to clarify as testing is ramping up

text:
this is a bug/edge case, the issue would be the following (if I understand correctly):

`place_order -> PENDING -> EXECUTABLE -> cancel_order() -> VIOLATION`

the order is then stuck in the violation status, in this case it should probably go

`place_order -> PENDING -> EXECUTABLE -> cancel_order() -> VIOLATION -> EXECUTABLE`

elements.text: this is a bug/edge case, the issue would be the following (if I understand correctly):
place_order -> PENDING -> EXECUTABLE -> cancel_order() -> VIOLATION
the order is then stuck in the violation status, in this case it should probably go
place_order -> PENDING -> EXECUTABLE -> cancel_order() -> VIOLATION -> EXECUTABLE

text: That's what seems to be occurring. It's just happened again with a remaining amount of 49p that failed to be cancelled and was matched 10 seconds later. I believe the order violation came as the result of a replace request to change from odds of 1.37 to 1.38 for a back bet. The initial order was completely unmatched according to the to the blotter but after the request I believe it was matched up to a size remaining of 49p
